data.title: What to expect from Apple's event on Tuesday: A budget iPhone and more
data.description: The launch will be livestreamed from Apple's Apple Park headquarters in Cupertino, California.

data.title: Steve Wozniak: Steve Jobs wasn't a natural-born leader, he worked to 'develop his communication' skills
data.description: Steve Wozniak says Steve Jobs compensated for his engineering skills by turning himself into a skilled communicator and marketer, all to help Apple succeed.

data.title: Shareholders vote for Apple to conduct a civil rights audit, bucking company's recommendation
data.description: The audit could encompass issues like gender pay equity, leadership diversity, and privacy related to products like AirTags.

data.title: Apple workers set to return to office beginning April 11
data.description: The move signals that big employers in California are comfortable enough with the current state of Covid-19 cases to reopen offices.

data.title: For Warren Buffett, Apple is his new Cola-Cola as the investing icon reaps $100 billion in six years
data.description: Warren Buffett's recent success from his massive Apple bet is spurring comparisons with the legend's greatest investment of all time — Coca-Cola.

data.title: Apple and FBI grilled by lawmakers on spyware from Israeli NSO Group
data.description: The letters come after The New York Times reported earlier this year that the FBI had acquired surveillance technology from the NSO Group.

data.title: Apple's decision to stop selling products in Russia puts pressure on other smartphone makers
data.description: Apple's decision to stop selling products in Russia puts pressure on other smartphone makers to do the same, according to analysts.

data.author: BloombergQuint Brand Studio
data.title: Top 5 priorities for India Inc Procurement Leaders in 2022
data.description: Top 5 priorities for India Inc Procurement Leaders in 2022

data.title: Apple sets date for first product launch of the year
data.description: Apple is gearing up for its first big product event of the year.

data.title: Ukraine wants Russia to be severed from the global internet. Experts say it's a risky idea
data.description: Over the past week, Ukraine's government has pressured major tech platforms to rethink how they operate with Russia, and it has been pretty successful. Social media companies have reduced the reach of Russian state-backed media outlets, for example, and Apple has stopped selling its products and limited some services in Russia.
